arm_group.description: Use of auricular acupuncture in bilateral ears
No needles with bandages on ears.

brief_summary.textblock:
The goal of this study is to assess the role of battlefield acupuncture in the reduction of
      pain scores status post adult tonsillectomy. Secondary goals of this study include reduction
      in narcotic usage, decreased nausea and vomiting, and evaluating patient factors that lend
      an increased risk of worsening pain or improved response with acupuncture.

clinical_study.brief_title: Auricular Acupuncture for The Treatment of Post-Tonsillectomy Pain

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Any adult patient who meets criteria and is scheduled for tonsillectomy

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Any patient with prior use of acupuncture

          -  Individuals under age 18

          -  Tonsillectomy performed with other surgical procedures, i.e UPPP, adenoidectomy,

          -  Patients with a known personal or family history of a bleeding disorder will be
             excluded.

          -  Patients with a history of kidney or liver problems will also be excluded.

          -  Patients found to be pregnant will be excluded from participation.

          -  Patients unwilling to enroll in the study will have the tonsillectomy with or without
             adenoidectomy performed according to current practice standards.

intervention.description: Application of auricular acupuncture to 5 points on the ear

clinical_study.official_title: AURICULAR ACUPUNCTURE FOR THE TREATMENT OF POST-TONSILLECTOMY PAIN

primary_outcome.measure: Reduction in VAS scores between experimental and control group

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.source: United States Naval Medical Center, San Diego

lead_sponsor.agency: United States Naval Medical Center, San Diego

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Subject), Primary Purpose: Treatment
